translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The forward and reverse order of conditions in the Paṭṭhāna, with the commentary in brief

analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya  kusala attika atīta ārammaṇa ttika
translated: The Triad of the Wholesome, the Triad of the Object of the Past🔽With the wholesome and the object of the past as condition there arises the unwholesome and the object of the future. (In brief.)🔽With the wholesome and the object of the past as condition there arises the unwholesome and the object of the present. (In brief.)

original: Kusalaṁ atītārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naatītārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: kusalam atīta ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na atīta ārammaṇaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With the wholesome and the object of the past as condition there arises the unwholesome and the object of the past and the present. (In brief.)🔽With the wholesome and the object of the past as condition there arises the unwholesome and the object of the future and the present. (In brief.)🔽With the wholesome and the object of the past as condition there arises the unwholesome and the object of the past, the future, and the present. (In brief.)

original: (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… aññamaññe tīṇi …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate nava.🔽Kusalaṁ anāgatārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naanāgatārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… avigate nava.
